ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 494
ygData.msgSnippet: ditto that, the merchants wont buy back unfired and it s not economical to buy the firing sheets to make them sellable. I mastered pottery in about 3 for
ygData.messageBody:
ditto that, the merchants wont buy back unfired and it's not economical to
buy the firing sheets to make them sellable. I mastered pottery in about 3
for around the same amout of plat, did it in NFP though while I was selling
so that's prolly why it took me longer :)

Tailoring (sigh), now that's time consuming and expensive. I'm up to Wu's
and those coldain tempers are costing me an arm and a leg. I'd just try
jumping straight to the wyvern and drake hides I have stacks of, 'cept the
cobalt cod, and drake eggs are a pain to get.

Nepeta - 54 druid
Veeshan server
Master .... hmmmm well technically Mistress of baking, brewing, pottery,
fletching, alcohol tolerance (had to test my microbrews didn't I?), fishing,
and tailoring <---(128) and still going

> > Haven't found a quick and easy way to advance pottery, yet. Tailoring
> > has been my primary skill, advancing with my main experience as I
> > made my own armor. Hope one day to make Misty armor.
>
> Pottery: Make medium *unfired* bowls from 1-122. Will cost no more than
> 25PP. Just destroy the unfired bowls.
>
> Pottery is, by far, the easiest and cheapest tradeskill to master. I did
it
> with 25PP and 2 hours one night.
>
>
>
